fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26039].
  {panel}

When migrating JIRA to another server, if there are timezone inconsistencies between the two servers it can cause considerable problems with the new server that may not be discovered until problems have been introduced into the dataset. Please enhance JIRA to timestamp an XML backup and provide a warning during XML restore that the backup does not match the server time of the instance it is being imported into.
* Times stored in the database is based on the JIRA JVM user timezone

h3. Workaround

In order to restore the times back to their last known working form, the below process can be used for the new server:

# Generate an XML backup from the previous server, or obtain the last-known working one and copy it to the new JIRA server.
# Schedule a downtime window.
# Stop the new JIRA server.
# Either:
#* Set the JVM timezone argument, e.g.: {{-Duser.timezone=GMT}}, as in [Setting Timezone in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Setting+Timezone+in+JIRA].
#* Change the System Time of the server that the JVM is running on (the JVM will default to that time).
# Start the new JIRA server.
# Import the XML backup from the previous server.
# Test JIRA.

If the server is unable to be rolled back, the below can be followed, however this is not the recommend method and may cause additional problems due to time inconsistencies.

# Schedule a downtime window.
# Export the XML backup.
# Stop JIRA.
# Either:
#* Set the JVM timezone argument, e.g.: {{-Duser.timezone=GMT}}, as in [Setting Timezone in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Setting+Timezone+in+JIRA].
#* Change the System Time of the server that the JVM is running on (the JVM will default to that time).
# Start JIRA.
# Import the XML backup.
# Test JIRA.
fields.summary: Verify the system timezone when an XML backup is restored
When in "Move" action, display the issue's Summary field - not just the issue key

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26034].
  {panel}

I am a testleader in agile projects.

We make the testcases in Jira - the feature that will be tested as a main-task, and the testcases/teststeps as sub-tasks under that.
When we make a bug, we link the bug-task to the testcase/teststep manually. This gives ut the possibility to see the status of all bugs that is related to a testcase. There is no point retesting a teststep as long as there is unresolved bugs related to it.

If we had a function that automatically made that link when we made the bug, it would decrease work for the testers, and increase the quality of the testcase, since they always had link to the testcase the bug was discovered in (vice versa).

This feature could be under "More actions - Make bug (issue)" (automaticly reference "Is made from")
fields.summary: action to automatically create a new linked issue
Jira installer should import proxy settings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26029].
  {panel}

Hi there, 

It is very frustrating when doing a bulk search on issues but not having sub-tasks appear immediately under their related issue.

I'm just wondering if you have considered adding either a sub-key, or changing the format of the key so that subtasks are displayed directly under their related issue after a search where the sort order is on the key.

As a suggestion, if I create an 'issue' which is given a key of "DEMO-1", can sub-tasks incorporate this key in some way rather than being given their own, unrelated key?

For example:
DEMO-1-1	first sub-task
DEMO-1-2	second sub-task

If the order of these sub-tasks is changed within the issue, then the key should change to reflect that.
fields.summary: Improve relationship between issues and sub-tasks
Re-add the ability for Project Administrators to be able to configure app links in their projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26025].
  {panel}

h2. complaint from our users: {quote}I don't want a notification email when someone else gets assigned{quote}
{quote}
Is it really important to send this kind of mails?
I am not watcher, nor in copy to, not reporter.
So the reason I received this mail, was because I was Assignee, but not anymore and someone else has changed that.
So I don't have to do anything anymore,
so I should not receive this update from JIRA by mail:
{quote}
{code}
----- Forwarded by LV@.... on 31/07/2011 11:27 -----
From:	"SH (JIRA)" <noreply@...>
To:	LV@...
Date:	28/07/2011 23:10
Subject:	SILKROAD Assigned: (SR-1329) Main icons - Blue




     [ http://..../browse/SR-1329?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:all-tabpanel ]

SH reassigned SR-1329:
------------------------------------

    Assignee: JB  (was: LV)

...
{code}



h2. Proposed solution
I think the email notification scheme needs to be extended to the user profile & so that users can select which events they want to be notified of. Ideally these settings should also allow for conditional rules. (such as the above mentioned _unless issue is already "In Progress"_ )
fields.summary: when assignee changes, previous assignee would prefer NO email notification, unless issue is already "In Progress"
Workflow import/export should record and preserve layout
Problems with Jelly AddActorsToDefaultProjectRole

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26022].
  {panel}

I wanted to share some feedback on JIRA especially as it relates to how we're prioritizing work between the Business and our IS department. I've set up a filter that pulls a view together from multiple projects that each have many tasks.

Among those projects we have an overall business priority and it would be awesome if I could edit that business priority directly in the table view provided in the above filter. I'm looking for a process like 1) Click on a cell to edit, 2) Make changes and hit enter to save, and records re-order based on sorting set. 

Right now the process is more like 1) Ctrl+Click a task to open it in a new tab from the filter view, 2) Click the edit link on left, 3) Change business priority, 4) Hit save button, 5) Close new tab, 6) Continue editing the filter view or hit refresh to see changes.

It seems like this would be a much easier way to enter data across multiple projects.

Thanks much, -Matt
fields.summary: Enable Text Edits from Within Filtered View

fields.description:
Hi,

1. We have no problem to send a test mail to a gmail user account using the form .../secure/admin/SendTestMail.jspa 
at  System -> Mail servers -> Send a test mail. Both the plain text and HTML email are 100% OK.
Yeah, the test emails initially arrive in Spam folder, but they *do* arrive.

2. However all real regular emails that are sent by Jira never succeed to arrive to Google Mail accounts. They are always rejected. 

It would be great if all regular emails could be sent *exactly* like the test email is sent (using same email transport configuration, email attributes, etc)

All details are bellow (sorry for slightly changing the real usernames and servernames below).

Hello Guys,

Are there any plans to implement this? I'm sure that there are a few customers who might benefit from this.

Cheers
Thiago Prisco

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26006].
  {panel}

When creating a permission scheme from a scratch, it is needed to set a lot of permission allowances for different user types/groups.
 It takes time to go through all the options adding the permission rules one by one.

Example:
You wish to grant 'create attachments' permission for the reporter, project lead, current assignee and 3 distinct groups.
This requires you to scroll down to the create attachment (or select it from the list on the 'Add New Permission' screen) on the 'edit permission scheme' click 'add' and then on the new screen select 'reporter' and click 'add'. After clicking 'add' the view is returned back to 'edit permission scheme' screen, scroll position being at top of the page (a minor annoyance, it could return to same scroll position as when the 'add' was clicked). Then you need to do the cycle again for adding the permission for project lead, current assignee and once for all the 3 groups.


Could it be possible to make an improvement, where you could use checkboxes (instead of radio buttons) in screen 'Permission Schemes' > 'Add New Permission' to be able to select multiple options at once.
 Also changing the single select menus (atleast the group menu) into a multi select menus would be helpful.

(See the attachment)

I understand there already is a similar request, but I thought I could provide a bit more information by creating a new one.
JRA-1390 << The related issue
fields.summary: Improving permission granting screen usability
As a program, I can opt into some form of optimistic locking when updating and issue via REST

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26002].
  {panel}

Currently a great doc here about configuring workflows, and how to add Transition properties. I can see it being useful to reference the JIRA Transition Properties doc from the workflows page.

e.g. From this section: [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Workflow#ConfiguringWorkflow-WorkingwithTransitionProperties]

Link to: [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Workflow+Properties]

This way the users can see how to add a transition property and what the available transition properties are.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25994].
  {panel}

The footer of the JIRA documentation links people directly to support.atlassian.com to get help.  This needs to be updated to point to a page with instructions instead:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Getting+Help

There are also a range of textual references to create a support request on support.atlassian.com that need to be updated for 4.4 and 4.3.

I realize this is a lot of grunt work, but direct linking to SAC bypasses the Support Tools Plugin, which is designed to give us all the information we need to help customers and improve the quality and speed of Support.
fields.summary: Direct links to SAC need to be replaced...
On Confluence, Jira Issues Macro does not work with some custom fields after upgrading to JIRA 4.4.x - "Unable to determine if sort should be enabled"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25991].
  {panel}

This seems to have been asked by JRA-14425 back in 2008, but at the time the Labels were a separate plugin, and I wasn't able to find whether this had been resolved as the links went to the LBL project, which I suppose was removed when the labels were included in the base JIRA software.

We are using JIRA 4.1.2, so if this has been fixed in a more recent release, that is fine too, but at the moment it isn't working as described in the documentation.

Our organization's usage prevents us from being able to give every user 'edit issue' permission (right now there are 5 people who have edit permission), but we would like to be able to broaden the scope of who is able to label issues (everyone would work, or even just have a separate permission we can add project roles to).

In the documentation there was no mention of any permission settings for the ability to edit/add/remove labels from issues, but I found the previously mentioned JRA-14425 which suggested that the permission was tied to the edit issue (which we've had to restrict).  This is consistent with the behavior we have seen here (those without the edit issue permission cannot add/edit/remove labels).

Thank you,

Casey
fields.summary: Separate permission to create/edit labels from edit issue permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25975].
  {panel}

*To Reproduce*
# Un-favorite one of your dashboards. Let's say your dashboard called Smelly is no longer a favorite.
# Now open this dashboard through Manage Dashboards - My
# Go to Tools - Share and share the dashboard to some people
# Update the new Share setting

*Expected Result*
Redirected back to Smelly

*Actual Result*
redirected back to Dashboard.jspa which is the last Favorite dashboard that you viewed.
fields.summary: after sharing a non-favorite dashboard, redirect back to that dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25974].
  {panel}

Hey Guys,

So, currently in JIRA you can select the Directory when you are creating users and groups. However, once you create them in the diretories, you cannot change this setting anymore. 

By implementing this, the users can easily solve almost any problem that might've occured during an upgrade, as well giving them the oportunity to change this setting on runtime, instead of having to do the upgrade again, or via database hacks.

Cheers
Thiago Prisco
fields.summary: Ability to change Users directories and Group directories

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25973].
  {panel}

h3. Description

On the View Issue screen, the Workflow button is disabled unless the maximum number of workflow items has been exceeded.

However, if the maximum is exceeded by one, the Workflow button only has one menu option.

Instead of showing the Workflow button if there is only one option, just show the extra option.  

I realize this has a few extra implications:

* Should the Workflow button just be hidden instead of disabled when it is not in use?
* What should the max actually represent?  Max buttons including the workflow button?

h3. Example

*In current scenario*, given transitions of Start, Resolve, Close, Confirm for a given status and a Max workflow buttons of 3, you would get:

|Start|Resolve|Close|Workflow \\ Confirm|

*In the suggested scenario*, given the transitions of Start, Resolve, Close, Confirm for a given status and a Max workflow buttons of 3 you would get:

|Start|Resolve|Workflow \\ Close \\Confirm|

but a Max workflow buttons of 4 you would get:

|Start|Resolve|Close|Confirm|

h3. The Benefits

The benefits would be:
* No wasted space when Workflow button not needed (because it would be hidden)
* No extra click when only one menu item

h3. Extrapolate

This obviously could be applied to Action buttons (though I don't know if I've ever seen the action list small enough to not need the "More Actions" button) and any other place this menu concept is used.
fields.summary: If "Workflow" button on View Issue screen only has one menu item, just show the item with no "Workflow" dropdown
JiraPluginSettingsFactory.createSettingsForKey(projectKey) should not load eagerly and the result should be cached for the rest of the request

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25968].
  {panel}

This was suggested by a customer recently:

The installer should have an option to set Jira up in a test environment on the same server and not disable the current instance.

This would make sense allowing the user to choose a port (other than 8080) for the installer to customise in server.xml. Currently nowhere does it allow for me to choose this:

{code}
sudo ./atlassian-jira-5.0-beta1-x64.bin 
Password: 
Unpacking JRE ...
Starting Installer ...

This will install JIRA 5.0-beta1 on your computer.
OK [o, Enter], Cancel [c]

Choose the appropriate installation or upgrade option.
Please choose one of the following:
Express Install (use default settings) [1], Custom Install (recommended for advanced users) [2], Upgrade an existing JIRA installation [3, Enter]
1
The following default options cannot be used. You will be asked to provide alternatives for these options.
* Installation Directory (Existing installation directory)
* Home Directory (Existing home directory)


Where should JIRA 5.0-beta1 be installed?
[/opt/atlassian/jira]
/home/michael/deleteme 
Default location for JIRA data
[/var/atlassian/application-data/jira]
/home/michael/deleteme1
See where JIRA will be installed and the settings that will be used.
Installation Directory: /home/michael/deleteme 
Home Directory: /home/michael/deleteme1 
HTTP Port: 8080 
RMI Port: 8005 
Install as service: Yes 
Install [i, Enter], Exit [e]
e
Finishing installation ...
{code}
fields.summary: Installer option to set Jira up in a test environment on the same server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25967].
  {panel}

Hello Guys,

The problem is somewhat simple to reproduce:
- choose a CSV file to be imported, and in this CSV file there are values which would be stored by custom fields
- before running the CSV import, manually create the custom fields, and associate the context to the project in which the issues will be imported (and not global context).
- run the CSV import, and map the custom fields to existing custom fields.
- in the end of the process, the issues will be imported, but JIRA will have created custom fields, with the same name and type, but in the Global Context (so there will be duplicated customfields).

The stacktrace is:
{code}
2011-10-13 18:33:07,001 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 WARN tfprisco 1113x155x1 r8vbmg 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/views/ImporterLogsPage!import.jspa [imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter$1Thread[http-8080-6,5,main]] Custom field 'Filename' is not available for all projects. Can't use it, going to create a new one.
2011-10-13 18:33:07,009 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 WARN tfprisco 1113x155x1 r8vbmg 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/views/ImporterLogsPage!import.jspa [imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter$1Thread[http-8080-6,5,main]] Custom field 'AssetType' is not available for all projects. Can't use it, going to create a new one.
2011-10-13 18:33:07,015 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 WARN tfprisco 1113x155x1 r8vbmg 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/views/ImporterLogsPage!import.jspa [imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter$1Thread[http-8080-6,5,main]] Custom field 'Reporter Email' is not available for all projects. Can't use it, going to create a new one.
2011-10-13 18:33:07,020 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 WARN tfprisco 1113x155x1 r8vbmg 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/views/ImporterLogsPage!import.jspa [imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter$1Thread[http-8080-6,5,main]] Custom field 'FileMaker ID' is not available for all projects. Can't use it, going to create a new one.
2011-10-13 18:33:07,027 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 WARN tfprisco 1113x155x1 r8vbmg 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/views/ImporterLogsPage!import.jspa [imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter$1Thread[http-8080-6,5,main]] Custom field 'Source' is not available for all projects. Can't use it, going to create a new one.
2011-10-13 18:33:07,034 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 WARN tfprisco 1113x155x1 r8vbmg 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/views/ImporterLogsPage!import.jspa [imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter$1Thread[http-8080-6,5,main]] Custom field 'Title' is not available for all projects. Can't use it, going to create a new one.
2011-10-13 18:33:07,046 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 WARN tfprisco 1113x155x1 r8vbmg 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/views/ImporterLogsPage!import.jspa [imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter$1Thread[http-8080-6,5,main]] Custom field 'School' is not available for all projects. Can't use it, going to create a new one.
{code}

So, the custom field needs to be added to the global context for the CSV import to work?

Cheers

Thiago Prisco
fields.summary: The CSV importer does not take into account already created custom fields which don't have the global context applied, but are applied to the projects which the CSV will import issues to
Easy and natural mail conversation about JIRA issues
Provide support for branching logic on screens
Add scheduled day/time for LDAP (Active Directory) Synchronization
Ability and permission to remove a user from the Participants list

fields.description:
For a given issue, in one comment a colleague put details inside a {html} block and now any new comment we put in this issue page doesn't show up, but if I click in "Issues Details (Printable)" we can see everything.

I don't know what's inside the {html} block that's holding the jira issue page to render properly. And I also can say that someone here reported the same problem with Confluence, but again I don't know how to retrive the offending {html} code. If I could only be able to edit a comment in jira issue...
fields.summary: Using block {html}{hml} to comment in a issue and now no new comments appears
I need to get acces to view the ACF tag ACT35867 details
Plugin Point for Saved Filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25954].
  {panel}

When a potential user clicks on a link to create an issue and is not logged in, they see the following message:

Errors

You are not logged in, and do not have the permissions required to create an issue in this project as a guest.

To create an issue first log in

And the `log in` text is a link (but not underlined as links usually are).

Why doesn't this page just show a login required screen like /browse/[PROJECT] does? Or better yet, show the actual login with the os_destination set?

We've had some folks who misinterpret the error notice and think they can't create an issue, which then leads to unusual emails and error reports and sometimes angry/baffled users. All because the message is telling them something they don't understand. Why not just do the login redirect for them?
fields.summary: Show the login screen when user attempts to create an issue and is not logged in

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25953].
  {panel}

As a member of Bamboo team, I am subscribed to email notifications for all events occurring within Bamboo project - issue creation/comments etc.
That's quite a lot of emails, but I try to read/skim them all - eventually.
My problem is that not all of these emails are equally important - comments on the issues I've been assigned too, participated in or created are much more important than others.
Up to June/July, JIRA email notifications contained a small header that included the information about assignee etc. - I've applied mail filters to this header
to redirect the really important mail into my main mailbox. With the new comment format, it's no longer possible.
So, my question is - is it possible to put this information back into the notification email? In case of HTML emails, it doesn't even have to be displayed, just included in the HTML body as a comment.
fields.summary: Please bring back assignee/reporter/... information into JIRA comment notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25950].
  {panel}

Hello Team,

So, the steps to reproduce are pretty straight-forward:
- Integrate JIRA with Crucible
- On a comment, refer to a Crucible issue (for instance, CR-TEST-73)
- JIRA will render the comment, and make the TEST-73 a link to a JIRA issue, whether making the whole string an link to the Crucible issue.

As there is no way to even disable the automatic linking, the above steps will make every comment which relatest to an existing issue key a link. The only workaround is to make the comment as a wiki comment, or encapsulate the comment (using \{code} for instance).

Is there any plans to make the automatic issue liking optional, and switcheable?

Cheers

Thiago Prisco
fields.summary: Automatic Issue linking links to the wrong issue if used in conjunction with Crucible
Filter Results Gadgets (for SPAC issues) doesn't work at JIRA dashboard.

fields.description:
When using the agile functionality (Greenhopper) it is common to have versions for one or more backlogs which do not normally have a release date assigned to them. I have written up a small example below and will attach a screenshot of a current project.

!backlog_version_example.jpg|align=right,thumbnail!
* Product Backlog [No Date]
** Approved Backlog [No Date]
** Wishlist [No Date]

* Sprint [Release Date]
** Iteration [Release Date]
** Iteration [Release Date]

When using a JQL function like [earliestUnreleasedVersion()|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching#AdvancedSearching-earliestUnreleasedVersion] it pulls back the "Product Backlog" in my example. What I would like is to be able to either set a parameter in the current JQL function or add a new JQL function to limit it down where dates are defined. Examples would include:

{code}
earliestUnreleasedVersion(PROJECT,hasReleaseDate)
{code}

OR

{code}
fixVersion in earliestUnreleasedVersion(PROJECT) AND fixVersion in scheduledVersions()
{code}

OR 

{code}
fixVersion in earliestScheduledUnreleasedVersion(PROJECT)
{code}

If one of these options are possible then when running a JQL query for [wall boards|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/23983] or Greenhopper [rapid boards|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Using+the+Rapid+Board] it would pull the earliest version with a release date, removing any problems with Product Backlogs.

NOTE: I have tried putting the release date way out in the future, but then the backlogs sort at the bottom of the lists. With the product owners being the least failure with JIRA, they tend to loose the backogs if they are not at the top of the versions in the planning board. 

Similar functionality was requested in JRA-22549. I have also spent some time looking at the [Versions Functions|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JQLT/Versions+Functions] of the [JQL Tricks Plugin|http://www.j-tricks.com/jql-tricks-plugin.html], but it does not have the functionality requested.
fields.summary: JQL function to see if a fixVersion has a release date defined (EMPTY)
[Notifications] Adding Facebook style notifications to JIRA
Need to document PluggableProjectOperation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25935].
  {panel}

On Ubuntu server when starting or stopping:
/opt/atlassian/jira/bin/setenv.sh: 97: pushd: not found
/opt/atlassian/jira/bin/setenv.sh: 100: popd: not found

This is because /bin/sh is pointing to /bin/dash by default (and dash doesn't support pushd & popd).
I was able to fix it locally using:
sudo unlink /bin/sh && sudo ln -s /bin/bash /bin/sh
but hopefully there's a nicer way to implement it.
fields.summary: Issue with setenv.sh when starting and stopping JIRA on ubuntu
Upgrade bundled JIM to 3.5.2
keep email style sheet links valid after upgrade
Display Issue Type on Issue Navigator for Linked Issues
Unrelated error message during Issue Type Migration process

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25924].
  {panel}

With fine-grained automated "External User Management" control, it will be useful in some set ups to allow admin to set the Internal Directory as enabled but read-only.

In particular if most your User management is done through a read-only LDAP or Crowd server, it is actually good practise to leave at least one System Admin user in the Internal Directory.
This user is used to edit the settings for the LDAP directory, and also in case of emergency if the LDAP server is no longer reachable (eg it changes IP address / port number etc).

Currently this means that JIRA has to assume that User Management is in general "writable", so it shows the "Forgot Password" link on the login page, there is an "Add User" button on User Browser etc.
Being able to set the Internal Directory to Read-Only would fix this.
fields.summary: Allow configuring the Internal Directory to be "Read Only"
More fine grained control of External User Management
System properties can not be edited

fields.description: There are some issues which disappear after a particular workflow action. After re-indexing, those issues appear again. However if we perform the workflow action, those again disappear. There is no error in the logs.
fields.summary: Issues not getting reindexed properly
Internet Explorer Memory Consumption with Gadget Refresh Interval

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25916].
  {panel}

We use JIRA as bug tracking tool in our company.  After we log a defect in JIRA, if it is pending for Client clarification status will be changed to ACC.  

Now we are trying to get a report in which we get the list of all defects from Day 1 of the Project till now which had gone through the ACC.  

I tried and was not lucky to find out any such option in JIRA.  
Please help me out with this.
fields.summary: To Fetch All Defects Till Date That Have Gone Through ACC Status
Bulk edit for Admins
Provide Webservice method setUserAvatar or REST resource
There should be more configurations which can be adjusted by projects - For example: Time Tracking, Resolution and Priority.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25909].
  {panel}

Hi, 
related to issue JRA-9652 where expand/collapse has been implemented for fields, I think it would also be of interest, like in the case of a long Description field, to truncate its contents to maybe 30 lines in the UI and have a 'See more ...' button/link that expands the Description so that you see all its contents. It's nice to have expand/collapse to save on scrolling, but it would be even nicer to see just a bit of the fields' contents as it's sometimes enough to get an idea what's in it.
What do you think ?

Thanks,
Cristian
fields.summary: Better expandable fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25905].
  {panel}

On the administration end, users cannot differentiate visually between the release and unreleased version with clicking on the tools icon.  

Improvement suggestion:
1) differentiate the text of the release and unrelease date in different colors or text style. 
2) Add _Release_ or _Unrelease_ next to the date ( I.e. 10/10/2011 (Release) )
fields.summary: Differentiate the released and unreleased version
Dynamic plugin upgrades from UPM do not reload Listeners or Services contained in that plugin

fields.description:
Currently, if an issue has multiple fixVersions set, a JQL like:

bq. fixVersion = "1"

will return all issues that have a fixVersion set to 1, including issues that have multiple fixVersions.  To further narrow down the search results you need to use NOT IN.  However each time a new sprint or nested version is created, we now need to update our filter to exclude the new nested version.  It would be nice if there were a "matches EXACTLY and ONLY this" function/command.
fields.summary: JQL to find issues that have exactly only one fixVersion

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25898].
  {panel}

This specifically applies to Customfield Type containing multiple fields.

I've attached the Custom field plugin that helps user to store multiple addresses as part of Issue. Will take that as example to explain the problem. Please do use

-> Each address is consists of Street, City and Zip code. All are three individual text fields. 
-> Using searcher (ExactAddressSearcher) available I can search on complete address. That's good till there.

Here are couple of issues that will use as reference:

Issue Number | Street | City | Zip Code
--------------------------------------------------
Issue 1 | Tasman | San Jose | 94533
Issue 1 | Manning St. | Santa Clara | 34343
Issue 2 | Cricket St  | Sydney | 11132
Issue 2 | Brooks Blvd | Tasman | 22343

Now if I search for "San Jose" I will get correct issue (issue 1).

Let's say that I just want to search for all issues with with street name = "Tasman". Expectation is I should get only "Issue 1" in result. But I will get both issues in search result, this is because Tasman is available in both issues as part of Street or City name.

And currently (as per my understanding) JIRA doesn't provide any way to do search on sub fields. 

Can you please add this functionality or help us to find out if there is any work around.

thanks,
Raju
fields.summary: Customfield Type Search based on subfields (Developer Feature Request)
Add the ability to set the sort with Smart Query in the Quick Search
Quick Copy Issue Number and Title
Please put default URL's back into the Incoming Authentication configuration for an Application Link to Conflunece in Jira
Categorizing comments
Associate Subversion AND FishEye Separately For Projects
Jobs from V2 plugins scheduled and persisted are not restored after JIRA restart
Gadget "Recently Created Chart" does not "respect" dateformat settings
View Status page takes a long time to load if you have lots of statuses and lots of Workflows
When a version name is changed, it would be nice if filters could be changed to match

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25869].
  {panel}

It would be most helpful if actions would automatically include a snippet/markup for the comment showing that the comment in the end was related to a specific action.

Example 1:
Adding a image with a comment merely adds a image and a comment. Yes this sounds exactly right, however, if there are many comments already existing, the comment gets lost. There's nothing indicating that comment was related to a specific image/attachment. When you click on the image, it takes over the screen showing the image, but the comment is not shown as a caption around the image. 

Example 2:
Resolving an issue with a comment does not refer back to the actual action of actually resolving. 

I understand that I could be labeling my comments appropriately at the beginning, but that is only if I do it. Company wide, I cannot guarantee that they will all look the same or even done by other users.
fields.summary: Tie Comments Back To Actions and Vice Versa or Automatically Prepend Related Info
Description Field of Components should render Hyperlinks
VWD - You cannot edit a transition immediately after adding it to the VWD workspace.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25862].
  {panel}

*Steps to replicate:*
# On JDOG, open the 'JIRA Development' project and from this project's workflow scheme, create a draft of the 'docs' workflow (which is used by the 'Documentation' issue type of this workflow scheme).
# Edit the draft 'docs' workflow and add a transition from the 'In Review' step to the 'Closed' step.
# In the 'Add Transition' dialog box, choose '*Clone Transition*' and enter a unique 'Transition Name'.
# Choose '*Close Issue*' in the 'Transition To Clone' field.
# Click '*OK*' and you get the 'Service Fault' error shown in the attached screenshot.
(!) Please be aware that this still happens even when the existing 'Close Issue' transition is not there.
(-) Please don't toy with this draft workflow - the Tech Writers are currently using the 'active' version of it.
fields.summary: VWD - JIRA generates a 'Server Fault' error when adding a cloned transition
On Projects gadget, if you click on the filter select drop down, the screen pops back to the top
Add support for file attachments bigger than 2GB
Update Documentation on JIRA 4.4 Release Notes (Visual Workflow Designer)
Uninstall script for UNIX/LINUX
User Profile - Timezone doesn't take daylight saving time/summertime into account

fields.description: As per a customer request, searching for issues by the number of Components or Fix/Affected Versions they have been assigned to would be helpful to their workflow. For example, they would like to find all issues with more than one component assigned to them.
fields.summary: Allow searching by number of Components / Versions
Accessing list of reports is not intuitive
Add Role Discriptions Back to Assignment Screen
Change Dashboard ownership
Enable to configure Workflow image with able to show/hide transition label(s) when user view it via Workflow Viewer.
